The service was great, the space was fun and matched the cuisine perfectly, and the owner came by to see how everyone was enjoying their food (everyone around us echoed the same rave reviews we had given). I mean, I hate to overuse the word but it was pretty... perfect.
author: Nina B.

description: Pizza is fine. Atmosphere is a bit loud, tables are small and uncomfortable, and it's dirty. The wait staff are pretty spaced out.
author: R. J.

description: PizzaHacker is so fantastic! Truly stellar pizza and a really great atmosphere. Friendly enough to kids that we can let them draw on the walls (literally) and be playful (within reason) but still the type of place that I would happily go with an adults-only group too, because wine on tap and Top Shelf Margherita is worth it every time.
author: Rebecca K.

description: Skip this place...I had a craving for pizza and this place definitely did not satisfy. Pizza is more like a flat bread with cheese and sauce that slides right off. Service was fair at best. In all fairness we walked in 15 prior to close so that could explain it. All I know is that I would never recommend this place or return to give it another shot.
author: Julia G.

description:
I don't know how to start this one....it's a vegetable centered restaurant focusing on fresh and local that makes pizza...no, wait. That's not totally right. It's a pizza place that creates magical pies from local vegies and goods...no, it's still not enough.

How about this: It's the first pizza restaurant where I have eaten that I leave feeling not too full and my tummy is as happy as my palate?

I can't rave enough about this place.

Usually, when people take something stock and standard and try to add "health" you get things like the "Sawdust Bakery" of my youth, or scary, slimey tofu burgers (with deference to an ex-roommate from college who shall remain nameless). 

My credo has been (and will continue to be), if it is not broken, do not attempt to repair away the calories, sugar or flavor with "healthy alternatives." I've had lo-cal desserts, imitation milk/sugar/fattening additives in things, Tofurkey (I shudder) and a mass variety of goods over the years and dutifully gone ahead and ingested them in the name of gastronomic trailblazing, all the while considering, quietly, that I actually just took one for the team.

I'm a hag. I loathe fake. If you want a potato chip, go get the real thing and eat it. Shall we discuss the brief encounter our culture had with fake fat in potato chips? And the fact that Depends sales shot up? Nevermind....

I eat well. I have lost 75 pounds as of the summer of 2015, and I know what I'm doing. I also like yogurt and all-bran for dessert at home. I know-I'm weird. But if I really want the real deal, I go out and get a little slice of cheesecake or some fresh fruit and toss it in cream. I don't eat 16 ounces of the stuff, either, I just have a good portion, call it done, and go back to being mindful for weeks on end.

But this place just blew me out of the water. All my preconceived notions of health and happiness ran together under one roof and I have nothing to grumble about (except that they're closed on Mondays. There, I'll obsess on that....)

With as hard as they work they deserve a day off. For the Rocket Man, they take arugula and mozzarella, add a cooked egg, put it on a beautiful crust of *whole wheat* (yes, I didn't stutter) --or some kind of whole grain--and it's beautiful. Add to that, no tomato sauce which, for me, is a relief (can't eat 'em) and I'm happy as a clam. The end result is the joy of eating arugula (aka "rocket") with its many flavors depending on temperature, and the crunchy, bready goodness of pizza like I haven't had since I was in Florence. Or New York. You pick.

The other fave is the Heavy Nettle with stinging nettles, straciatella cheese--a lovely invention from Apulia--and two flavors my Middle Eastern friend recognized: Harissa and Zatar. An amazing mouthful complemented by a lamb sausage that makes me want to curl up in a little ball and purr. 

A nice touch? We tried the Yo Vinny! one night. I braved tomatoes for a day...I didn't say I won't, just that I can't. Or shouldn't. Anyway, I suffered for your enjoyment. My Middle Eastern friend (we go there a lot) saw the pork sausage and almost removed all meat when they suggested switching it up with the Heavy Nettle: try the lamb sausage on this! It's really good!

The beers they have vary by the week/month and they always have four to choose from. And a great selection of wines, AND some fabulous salads. 

I obviously can't rave enough about the place, so I'll just stop right here, but the food is fab, the service efficient and warm and the whole place has the ambience of that comfy, funky place we all frequented in college. Now with much better food.
author: Steven H.

description:
Top 4 Pizzas in the city next to Pizzetta, Tony's, and Presidio Pizza Company. The owner is a badass and stays true to his FrankenWeber roots, with emphasis on a simple but well-executed menu and fresh ingredients. Definitely California style, but with the perfect amount of char and texture on the dough, as opposed to the skimpy "crusty-thin" vibe that Delfina has. 

Great beers too. Will make the trek across town to come back.
author: Mark C.

description:
There was a dark time in the universe; one where I would have to track and hunt down the PizzaHacker.  Stalking Twitter, seeking him out, huddled next to a Frankenweber and a long line of hungry pizza goers, standing on the streets, chasing that pizza horse...in the event he wasn't out, I'd have to seek and find some other pizza from a store, establishment, or truck.  Occasionally I'd try to make a pizza myself, which never worked; hunter's aren't cooks. it was demanding and no more.

The PizzaHacker opens a brick and mortar.  In its soft launch I came in to seek the pizza I've always wanted. There it was on the menu.  Labeled on the board as the "Rocket Man".  Arugula, lemon, chili pepper, mozzarella and and egg.  Cooked, charred every so gently on the sides, and on the table swiftly.  This pizza is beyond explanation and is all you'd ever want.  There are a few other pies on the menu and a salad...but I don't imagine not getting the Rocket Man unless it's no longer seasonal.  

Till then, a quick walk to La Lengua is all I need till my next pie.
author: David S.

description: I have never eaten better pizza in my life. The house-made sourdough crust is to die for and the tomato sauce, cheese and sausage are all made in house as well. "Rocket Man" pizza comes with a cage-free non GMO egg cooked on top, and all of the ingratiates were SO fresh. The lovely bartender also told me all their beers and wines are local. Very classic San Francisco.
author: Madison H.

description: Don't understand a lot of the negative reviews of this place, nonetheless we didn't let them scare us away and I'm glad! This is great thin crust pizza, I recommend the Rocket Man with added chorizo. The price seemed spot on for me! Went there with a group of 9 and ordered a ton of pizza and beer, payed roughly $15/person. Can't wait to come back!
author: Andy F.

description:
Nothing exceptional about the pizzas here. We ordered the Top Shelf Marg and the Short Bridge. Took about 30 minutes to receive our order, so when we received the marg, we killed it. The 2nd pizza came, and after eating a few bites, we realized they gave us the wrong pizza..but whatever, we were so hungry that we didn't care. Service is somewhat lacking, so it took awhile to flag anyone down to get the bill. They didn't seem very happy or care much about whats going on around them. 

All in all, nothing that good, pretty meh flavors. Delfina is definitely the better choice if you want pizza in the area. Cheeseboard in Berkeley is the best in the bay if you want to make the trek there.
author: Venus L.

description: Ok, seriously, Pizzahacker is the best. From the kind, generous service to the yummy wines to the amazing, well-dressed salads and to the BEST PIZZAS in town -- clear eyes, full hearts, can't lose! You'd think at a place with food this good, there could be attitude or something, but they are the NICEST people. Very tolerant of young children, which is deeply appreciated, and yet grown-ups can have a nice, casual, high-quality meal in every way. And they play good music. The vibe here is excellent and reminds me of the Mission before all the tech. A very welcome addition to the neighborhood.
author: J P S.

description: Pizzahacker was very accommodating at offering another chance to eat at their place and hope for a better experience- and I really appreciate that . Its probably better to eat there , rather than order in the pizza.
author: Madhulika G.

description: Delicious pizza, huge yummy salads, and inexpensive drinks. What could be better? Get here early as it is small and does get crowded.
author: Pamela W.

description: The kale salad was good and plenty large. The pizza was too floury and lacked flavor, but we appreciated the nice crisp crust. Service was lacking.
author: Lauren D.

description: Great pizza, one of my favorite pizza places.  I want to eat there right now and i'm not even hungry.
author: Michael E.

description: Great Pizza, reasonable price and kid friendly. They also have a great pick up service as well since parking is not easy, they will bring your pizza outside to you. but pizza is really great if you like thin crust.
author: Deborah C.

description: This pizza was SOOOOO good! Was not feeling pizza when suggested, but I took one for the team and didn't even complain. Thank heaven I kept my mouth shut. Nothin but pizza and 2 salads and it didn't even matter. The Pinot noir was actually good from the plastic carafe and every single person that came to our table was greater than the last. Meaning of course that the entire staff was awesome!!! I wish they had a spot in Los Angeles cause I am sold. I went with a friend and I promised him I would mention the gals were adorable and he really, really, really appreciated the midriff that one was wearing!! Any who... Go here they rule!!
author: Krysta S.

description:
I really didn't want to like this place. I am anti anything "hacker." No, it's not because I am an internet securities agent. I just hate this phenomenon of calling something "blah blah blah" then hacker at the end as a way to express expertise in something done quickly and at low cost. 

My most hated is "growth hacker." Just accept you're a marketer, will you. God, can't stand it.

Anyways, I'm straying.

There was a 2nd thing going against PizzaHacker. I don't always love "fancy" pizza. 

Despite this, PizzaH... hhhacker is good. Its sourdough crust is thin with perfect combination of chew and crisp. Their ingredients are fresh and delicious. And anything is good with an egg on top.... including pizza. 

I also do like the vibe in there with the communal tables and high ceilings. It's casual , delicious with reasonable prices. Service has been hit or miss. 

I just hate the name so bad. Oh well, I've accepted it. I'm over it. The name is dead to me. 

Try it. You'll like it. If you can get over the name.
author: Bonnie H.

description:
Best pizza I've had in SF. 

THE SLICE:

Deep, complicated flavors in this pizza, we had the Yo Vinny, a sausage and onion pie. They make the melty delicious sausage in house, the mozz had a distinct sweet flavor, and the crust was perfect. This comes from someone who never ever eats their crust. 

Their table house hot pepper sauce is delicious, but use sparingly. 

THE VIBE:

Casual and comfortable with high ceilings, service was quick and professional. 

INSIDE SCOOP:

Apparently they run out of things early, so either show up early, or call ahead.
author: Patrick T.

description:
Absolutely delicious! Yo Vinny, Get a Room.. it's all delicious!

I've taken many people here and have yet to see anyone dislike it.  A gigantic chalkboard wall for the kids, beers on tap and reeealy good pizza..

(a very short walk to Mitchells Ice Cream after makes it part of an awesome evening for kids and adults alike!)
author: Cmd C.

description: I here they will deliver bunches of Kale to yr door step even if you live in the East Bay!
author: Erin A.

description:
This is the second time I've got Pizza Hacker delivered through Postmates.

A die-hard Jersey girl, I've been more than a little upset about the pizza options in SF. Sure there are some great novelties, but I've yet to find that awesome, thin crust that I loved growing up.

Then my boyfriend told me about Pizza Hacker after they catered an office event.

BAMMMMMMM. I've ordered the Yo Vinny! twice because, well Jersey. It's incredible. Super sweet onions and peppers with a nice bubbly cheese on a buttery thin crust. The tomato sauce (not usually a highlight for me) was on point - sweet with a nice flavor profile. The sausage was great, just could have been a little bit more present.

I always order the pizza 'uncut' and throw it in the oven when it gets here for 4 mins. It's just the best, can't wait to try others!!
author: Alexandra K.

description:
It's honestly stupid how good this pizza is. I've been following the adventures of pizza hacker since he started when I was in LA. He was just a mythical legend to me. I always said if I went up to SF I would visit him. 

Fast forward five years, I moved to SF and I find out he's got his own brick and mortar location!! 

I've been here three times now and each time I've had a fantastic pie. I don't consider myself a pizza connoisseur by any means but I'd like to say I've eaten a fair amount of pizza (read: a disgusting amount). I've done my pizza tour of SF multiple times:

Little star (best deep dish, specifically on Valencia. Yes....I ate at the divisadero and the marina location too...) 
Golden boy 
Zachary
Tony's 
A16
Arizmendi
Del popolo
Delfina
That pizza place in the farmer's market on alemany
Gioia
Pibar

And although some of these are very close, if I had to pick one, I'd come back to pizza hacker. 

If pizza hacker reads this review, I hope you continue your excellence and attitude towards making fantastic pies. You more than deserve the hype!
author: Jonathan H.

description: Meh pizza, 4 beers on tap, and the place was freezing! We were going to eat in but had to grab and go bc the place was like an icebox.
author: Brittany R.

description:
Stopped after work and ordered a pizza from PizzaHacker. 

I was having a friend over to watch the Giants game at my house. This place is pretty close!

I ordered a PURPLE RAIN Pizza, it had purple tomatoes, proscuitto, basil, mozzarella,  parm & balsamic. It was really delicious & tasty. Sweet and just enough salty perfection. The crust was kinda thin but that's how I like my crust. All the flavors worked very well together.

I had made a quick tossed salad (since I had the fresh ingredients already) and of course I had a couple of cold Sam Adams to help wash down our pizza.

The BEST part......the Giants Won!
Humm Baby.....just one more win until we are.......in the World Series.....again!
author: Janet T.

description: After moving to Glen Park, Pizza Hacker has become almost a weekly destination. The pizza, salads, and wine are great, and the staff is friendly. Sometimes we have to wait - but never more than ten minutes or so. Easily one of my favorite casual meals in San Francisco.
author: Paul T.

description: Holy smokes, in a region with a great variety of excellent pizza, PizzaHacker is still near the top.  I didn't even eat the pizza fresh, I had to heat it up after sitting around for a couple hours at home.  And it was still incredible.  The crust is perfect.  Crunch to chew to char ratio is perfect.  The toppings are high quality, well balanced, and extremely flavorful.
author: Mike L.

description:
Had the seasonal Short Bridge: meat, mushrooms, cheese... what's not to like? Downed it with a Henhouse saison.

Pro tip: these Neapolitan pizzas are best eaten while still hot-ish. Not that awesome when they get cold, so eat up fast.
author: Maximillian M.

description: I sat at the bar and ordered a Short Bridge.  Delicious crust, just the right amount of sauce, tasty meat toppings.  Some of the better pizza I've had in SF - similar to Pizzeria Delfina and A16.  Super fast, friendly service (I watched them make and bake my pizza in under 10 minutes - that's the beauty of an incredibly hot oven). Nice, casual neighborhood vibe - great experience.  I'll be back!
author: Andrew E.

description:
I've been there a few times and would say they generally have good (no great) pizza. We ordered the other day and got two pizzas, one of which was pretty good and the other was burnt to the extent that all of the crust was inedible. Whenever a mishap goes wrong to the extent it ruins a meal, I always provide feedback to the company first. I let them know but got zero response, which gives me much greater concern than the occasional burnt pizza.

Worth noting for first timers: I appreciate that they try to make the carry out easier with their testing system but it's still very hard to find parking.
author: Daniel O.

description: I love this place. Their pizza is just fantastic. They also have a very good salad and a small but good selection of tasty beers. I recommend the Rocket Man. They also have a delicious Mexican chocolate ice cream from Mitchell's. I never get tired of Pizza Hacker. I could eat here every night.
author: Barney C.

description:
Don't get me wrong. The pizza is great! However, the customer service is not. 

Just got back from ordering a pizza to go from PizzaHacker. I ordered a no meat Yo Vinny's without sausage. Went to pick it up, and lo and behold, it has sausage on it. No big deal. Mistakes happen. I nicely bring it up to the cashier, who promptly rolls his eyes, and asks me to wait for a new one. Do I get a "Hey man. Sorry for OUR mistake. Would you like a beer/wine/some water for the wait?" as I awkwardly stand in the corner? Nope. I was a pest. I'm in the business of being blamed for other people's mistakes, but at a restaurant? I don't think so.
author: Felix C.

description: This is hands down the best pizza in SF. It starts with the owner, ingredients, and staff all of which are obsessed with quality. The dough and sauce and cheese are head and shoulders above the rest. On your first trip have the Top Shelf which is just awesome.
author: Ward C.

description:
Meh. Pizzas are fine, but unexceptional. Pizzetta 211, Delfina, and Zero Zero all do better pies. The salad was fine too, but overdressed.

Cool space, although they blasted punk metal throughout the meal. I guess some people must like that kind of music, but I don't think they cared that all the diners in the restaurant (our party, and a family with small children) clearly found it unpleasant.
author: David C.

description: This is my most favoritest pizza place in SF. I must have eaten her once a month since it has opened. Its my go to. Unpretentious, comfortable, friendly and did I mention amazing food. I am so glad they are here. The owner is rad and so is the whole crew of lovely people who work there. They do it right, from the small menu of amazing food to the reasonable prices and great service.
author: LaReina H.

description:
I've eaten here twice.  I would have been three times, but the first time hubs and I tried to go, there was a sign out front that indicated that they had run out of pizza dough.  Hey, it happens.  That shit is fresh.

SO! The verdict: good stuff, man.

The pizza is tastilicious with all those blackened crust bubbles that lesser establishments tamp down with those rolly pokey things.  WHY GOD WHY would you prevent those glorious bubbles?

Yeah, so it's basically super delicious and fresh neopolitan.  Go classic if that's what floats yer boat (they have margherita and other faves like that) or get something CRAZY with, like, I dunno, SPANISH CHORIZO.  Delish.  Taste buds of the bay area rejoice.

Wine list is only okay, they have one rose, which is also okay, but sidenote, doesn't look like rose b/c the tables are painted red/orange, so the wine looks entirely clear.  LOL.
author: Rachel S.

description: One of the best pizza places in the city! Tomato sauce very fresh and love the thin crust. Service was spectacular.
author: Pairadoc S.

description: Perfect menu. Perfect vibe for our family. Amazing crust and nice proportion of topping to crust.
author: Monica B.

description:
Pizza Hacker is great, I like the space, it's delicious pizza, salads are healthy and tasty. I think 
the wine is waaaay better than most places in Bernal.

Yum!
author: Cesar R.

description:
Pizzahacker doesn't really describe what this place is but rather where it came from. The owner hacked a regular weber grill into a pizza oven and had a regular pop-up. The grill is on display above the door.

The food that comes out of the permanent kitchen is incredibly thoughtful and reminds me of some of the best pizza places in Italy. Fresh fresh ingredients that shine on a to die for crust. Dare I say best pizza in the city? I think for me it is, especially since the price is great for the quality.

I love the ambiance, it's very casual and the Christmas lights are hung to make it feel like a backyard patio but inside a huge cavernous building. Service matches and is casual and friendly.
author: Ge O.

description: I would give pizza hacker like a 4.4 but not quite a 5 star. The special margarita pizza was incredible. They home make their mozzarella and it comes out soooo well on that pizza. We also got a meat/sausage pizza but that pizza wasn't as amazing which brings this place down to a 4. I still think it's better than Delfina/Little Star/Golden Boy but not quite 5 star pizza.
author: Rohan S.

description: Near my house, small but thoughtful beer selection, salad was giant. Now the pizza. The crust was amazing. The sauce, cheese and toppings are okay but nothing stellar.
author: Will D.

description:
The new king of pizza in San Francisco. Somehow their sourdough crust manages to be crispy on the bottom but chewy in the middle.. a next-generation texture that left me wanting more. All of the toppings are delicious especially their house-pulled mozzarella. 

They're right across the street from Ichi and Blue Plate which proves that this little corner of Bernal is quickly becoming one of the hottest places in the city for great food.
author: Aaron V.

description: Small place, had that hipster feel. The menu is small, not alot of selections. Cant lie tho', the pizza (Short Bridge) & salad was pretty good. The ginger ale, eehh not used to the taste (a bit diff) lol. Customer svc. was great (very friendly). Will we dine again, YES!
author: Scarlet G.

description:
Excellent topping quality and taste. Would have liked more than 4 crumbles of sausage we had to fight over on the Yo Vinny.

Crust usual tasteless paper thin neapolitan style. 

Friendly fast service. 

Crowded, loud and not very clean looking.
author: Nancy G.

description:
Good pizza. TERRIBLE atmosphere. 

I've been a fan of Pizza Hacker's pizza since back in his mobile days. This isn't a town for great pizza, so even "good pizza" is nice to come by. I was thrilled to see Pizza Hacker was opening right near my house. This pizza is still good, but the experience of dining there was so unpleasant that I won't be back. It's like Chuck E. Cheese in there. Screaming children everywhere, and parents that decide it's okay to let them run free. The acoustics are so bad that all you hear are echoing screams. I don't need to eat my pizza in a fancy restaurant, but this is just beyond chaos.  Also, two people had dogs with them. In the restaurant. Who does that?? The service, while pleasant, is REALLY slow. After my dinner last week, we just wanted to escape the screaming children. It took 30 minutes just to get a check. Argh! 

As for the pizza, pretty good. I'll probably get it again, - BUT AS TAKE OUT ONLY! We ordered both the margherita and the "top shelf margherita" to compare. They tasted the exact same, so save your money and go with the cheaper option. And FYI, the pizzas are smaller than they look (very thin), so order more than you think you'll need.
author: Joyce G.

description: Places like this prove that the best pizza in the world is without a shadow of a doubt in the US of A. Italy, what a joke... Lots of different combinations, basically none of them involving anything usual. In all honesty although the pizza was very good, it's not my preference of meat toppings (I would go for pulled pork or chicken over chorizo or prosciutto) and thus the 4 stars but there is no doubt this is a 1st class pizza establishment. They also have some good beers on tap. Definitely recommended
author: James C.

description:
The phrase "you're trying to hard" applies to PizzaHacker. First off, the term hacker is way overused this days. Maybe it's a San Francisco startup thing. That said, if you're going to only have 5 pizzas on the menu (like PizzaHacker) they should all be solid. The Heavy Nettle pizza in particular was terrible. My wife and I were up to try something new, but we couldn't even finish it. I had the sensation of eating seafood while eating pizza...not good. We paid $41 for pizzas we didn't even finish.

I realize people say you want to do something to stand out among pizza joints. However, it seems hard to find a solid, straightforward pizza place to begin with in San Francisco. You don't have to be out of the box to be a great pizza joint. That's why I think PizzaHacker is trying to hard.
author: Jason W.

description:
I'm from New Jersey and a bit of a pizza snob.

Yes, the name of this place is a bit dopey. That said, this place is now probably my favorite pizza place in SF.

I always get the Purple Rain which is tasty, delicious, bubbly, sweet and salty perfection. The cheese, the sauce, the sweet purple tomatoes....(((((drool))))). I love the thin crust with bits of sea salt on it. 

I like the kid-friendliness of the place and the bill is always cheaper than when we go to other pizza places in the city. 

I only wish perhaps that it weren't so noisy inside. It can get quite loud.

Also one of my sons is gluten intolerant and sadly they don't have gluten free options. So I can only go when my oldest son isn't eating with me. When we are all together as a family we are forced to go to Paxti's instead because of the gluten free option. I much prefer pizza hacker to  Paxti's.
author: ellen c.

description:
It's great to have a hipster pie place in the neighborhood. And for that, I am grateful. My pals and I split 2 pizzas: The Pizza Margherita and Vinny's looked great. And if a place can't make it on the pizza Pizza Margherita, they probably should open a Shakey's. We also ordered a salad and a carafe of the Pino aka "wine on tap."

The salad is less than impressive - mushy and lackluster dressing. 

I've had wines that were better from a box, for much less than $37.

Now for the headliner: The Pizza. Excellent, most excellent flavors. Even with a little too much salt, the crust is perfection. The sauce is a little thin; but the flavor of the fresh basil and mellow tomato goodness with the hot melty mozzarella is sublime.
author: Janet P.

description:
The menu isn't large, but what we had was good.  My GF and I split the top shelf margherita and the Yo Vinny.  It was about the right amount of food.  The Yo Vinny was a bit sweet and I think it was due to the pickled peppers.  I didn't mind the sweet, but I wasn't expecting it.

You'll have to deal with communal seating but it's an opportunity to meet some new people, right?
author: Larry L.

description: The pizza was really tasty. The mozzarella was really fresh and a real highlight. The pizza crust was good but be sure to eat it fast while it's warm because it hardens when cold. Definitely kid friendly. The hot pepper oil past was good too.
author: James P.

description: Chill, local spot for thin crust pizza that is kid friendly. Inside reminded of being at an outdoor party at night. Tried the Yo Vinny and Margarehita which were pretty good. The highlight was the super sweet onions on the Yo Vinny.
author: Josh L.

description: Pretty good pizza. The one to remember had dandelions in it. Thought it'd be a bit strange since I never had dandelions before even though I was aware that people eat them. It was pretty good I must say. Good mix of flavors too. The pizza is on the thinner side of crust just for you to keep that in mind. The white sauce on the pizza is good. Salad is plenty enough for at least 4 people too:)
author: Julie L.

description:
Nice crust, but hardly any toppings.

If a thin crust and bubbly charred extremities are all you are looking for then you are in luck, however if you expect that and some toppings or dare I say it - flavor - than look elsewhere.

Tried each of their four pizzas and all were underwhelming. Bland. Sparse. Disappointing. Not satisfying. Comprende?
author: Easwud C.

description:
Good pizza although my Asian mother would not approve of how charred the crust sometimes is. 

Our group shared three pizzas. All were good but the best one was the classic margherita. Not so classic really. I'm not sure what they do to it but somehow it is extremely creamy and delicious. 

Kind of an odd neighborhood but every time I visit my friend I'm Bernal Heights we walk down to Mission Street to see what new cool restaurant f has popped up.
author: Victoria W.

description: Everything about this place was amazing from the service to the food! Pizza is reasonable & taste great! I will be back!
author: Lei F.

description: This is my new favorite pizza spot.  It has surpassed Tony's and Mozzeria's and almost Delfina's.  The service is attentive and the music  playlist diversity is great.  Nice beer pairings and the spinach and hedgehog mushroom pie was fantastic.  Get in here before everyone discovers it!  Sunday afternoons are not crowded and the pizzas come out of the fire with a nice charcoal super thin crust.  They use their own yeast which blends well with the fresh tomato sauce.
author: April M.

description:
I came,  devoured and  left.  

Quick and easy for a early Sunday dinner.  And when I say early it's like the early bird time for old timers and families with kiddos.  Nothing wrong with that but that plays for a diff vibe for sure.   Picnic bench seating was also interesting but I think it's set up just fine for large groups. 

We ordered the margherita pizza and the Yo Vinny.  Both pizzas were fantastic- loved the crust and toppings and it just was a party in my mouth.  I'll def be back! Cost of 2 pizzas with tax/tip almost $40. When did pizza get so expensive (though that's the going rate for pizza nowadays in SF).
author: Julie F.

description:
Every bite of pizza was better than the last. No joke. Even just the one with literally sauce and crust. Amazing. Was a little tricky coordinating with 4 adults and 2 little kids to get a long table near the chalk board (and then to find a piece of chalk to draw with) but we managed. Wait staff was low energy (overall seemed a bit grouchy or maybe just overworked?), but once we bit into the pies all was forgiven.

Forgot to ask about the name. Anyone know the story behind it?
author: K. C.

description:
Get here early because they WILL run out of pizza! 

The first time we tried to come here, the door was closed and they'd run out (Friday around 8:30 pm).

The second time, we put our names on a list, waited 45 minutes, then were told we could only get one pie, then no pies, then they gave us free salad and beer, and then they said they could actually make us one pie. 

They were super awesome and genuinely sorry, and gave us a ton of salad and beer to compensate. 

The pie we got was the Crowd Pleaser. It was delicious.
author: Sonya Z.

description: I love the Pizza Hacker!  Fantastic pizza (current favorite - Get a Room and Top Shelf Margherita), a hearty, delicious salad, and super-nice people working there.   Its fun to write on the walls alongside the kids too.
author: Daniel W.

description:
I wish that I could give 0 stars. This review is solely based on the manager that I spoke to who was incredibly rude to me. I am new to the neighborhood and tied to place an order. All I wanted was one pizza and it was not even for delivery. It was for pick up. 
I was told they could not take my order at all - period. I was so excited to try this place even explaining to the manager that I just purchased a home one block away and was stoked to try our local pizza joint- which he sarcastically said "Well good for you congratulations -we can't take your order" I tried to reason with him asking if he could have my order ready in an hour (more than standard for a pizza joint). He declined my reasoning and continued to be incredibly cocky and rude. I was feeling such a sense of community in this neighborhood especially after seeing how we came together with the horrific fire that occurred last weekend. They might serve great pizza but not without an attitude and sense of entitlement. I was potentially a great customer. No longer.
author: Kelly M.

description:
Loved this spot for eating with little kids! Chalkboard walls, benches, un-crowded dining room, and a casual atmosphere make this a perfect place for hungry kids that won't sit still. 

Plus, the excellent pizza and tasty beer make it a great place for parents! 

Our family loved it and will certainly go back.
author: Cooper M.

description:
We were expecting more from this place. Others raved about the salad which was ok. The beans were clearly canned and could have benefited from a rinse or vinegar

We got the "get a room" pizza. The crust was excellent, the oven and dough were impressive. It was fine but just lacking in flavor. The sauce had no tomato zing and the cheese barely there, was ....barely there. Their chile condiment added the most flavor but not sure if they made it. Chorizo had little flavor, thank god for a few olives. Cute place but likely won't venture over again.  Beretta, pizza shack and 00 have the flavor and zest we are looking for. Hope they improve
author: andrew s.

description: Great pizza at a (comparatively) great price. Mostly get the Yo Vinny togo (warning, thin crust cools fast, so hurry home!). Great beer choices as well (not a lot of options, but all good).
author: David M.

description:
My favorite pizza in SF.  AND, they serve the food quickly, prices are totally reasonable, and very kid friendly (though the many parents that come here really need to clean up their kids' messes - paying a tip is not a license to leave your toddler's food disaster all over the table and on the ground.  Really, it's not.).

Thanks Pizza Hacker!
author: Rob P.

description:
Honestly, I just went to famous famous famous Roberta's in Bushwick, Brooklyn (basically the reason Bushwick became "cool"), and I think PizzaHacker is on par. The charred crust, the homemade sauce and handpulled mozz, and ingredients so fresh I could swear they have a whole farm of pizza toppings growing on their roof...I am so spoiled now that this place is 1 block from my house.

Their menu is small and edited down to things they excel at. The Top shelf margherita, Summer Fave (lemony! peppery! bright!), and the Purple Rain are my favorite, but honestly nothing I've ever put in my mouth on the PizzaHacker premises has been anything short of D E L I C I O U S, including the beer and wine. 

Speaking of beer, wash it all down with a smooth pint of Charred Manzanita Ale. You won't regret it.
author: Laura M.

description: Delicious, premium ingredients, super-nice folks, what's not to like. Welcome to the neighborhood, PizzaHacker!
author: David H.

description:
The pizza is great, I'd say in the top 5 for San Francisco.  They have nice ingredients, their recipe for the dough is good and has a nice crisp finish, cooked quickly at 666 degrees.  

The space could be better.  While I like the bench seating, the ceilings are high which creates an echo chamber.  Also the chalkboard walls leave a dusty atmosphere, but the pizza makes it worth it.
author: Aaron F.

description:
Read on Bernal Wood that pizza hacker was having its grand opening today and giving out free pizza. Since it was just down the street from my house, I made my way after work to check it out. 

The three pizzas I had were absolutely yummy. Classic Margherita, one with fig, and another with Brussel sprouts. Crust was crispy and light. Flavors were simple and out was easy to taste of all the ingredients. I didn't come out feeling overly stuffed. It was just right.

Will definitely come back as a regular!
author: Teresa Y.

description:
A friend recommended Pizza Hacker, so we dropped by around 8pm on a Friday night. We grabbed drinks at the bar, then waited no more than 10 minutes for a table to open up. Communal style seating with benches! We had a group of four so we ate alone. It's very noisy in here, but most restaurants are in the Mission these days. 

Even though we all laughed at the terrible name, my friends and I all agree the food was delicious! We started off with the salad which had a couple different kinds of beans, veggies and a nice poppy seed dressing - great! Then we split two pizzas, one meat & one veg which was plenty. Yo Vinny with snausage, etc. and then Rocket Man with an egg on top (cooked perf), topped with a generous amount of lemony arugula - yum! So good! Crust is thin and good - I ate it all, and I never finish my crust!

Would definitely come back again to try some more za.
author: Brittany L.

description:
I forgot the names of the pizzas I had, they were two of the seasonal ones. BUT both were delicious! 

Loved the cripsy thin crust. 

Toppings worked well with each other. I love the light sprinkly of this black salt they have. Yum. 

Environment was alright, didn't like their bench seating that much but eh.
author: Erica L.

description: the flavors are there, crust is slightly burnt but its still tolerable I would like to go back for their other pizzas but definitely not gonna spend my $15-20 on a small sized pizza that I devoured myself although I enjoyed it I felt guilty afterwards because I wish there was more! I wish they put more toppings than 2 dinky sopressatas like breh freal?!? thats it?!?
author: Mara G.

description:
Top Shelf Margherita pizza - for an extra $2, you get the Early Girl tomato sauce which is sweet/tangy, and delicious. Highly recommend over the regular Margherita pizza. 

Salad - it's HUGE. It can feed at least 3 people or more. Very fresh, light and simple. 

Parking - across the street at the BofA lot, there's parking for a flat fee of $12. Kinda steep if you have no other reason to be in the area but it's an option if you can't find street parking.

This is a VERY casual restaurant so if you showed up looking like you just rolled out of bed, I'm sure no one would notice.
author: Jules L.

description: Best pizza I've had in a reeeeally long time! lol They're kinda small but they pack a punch of deliciousness. We ordered three different kinds. They were all good! This is my weekly spot now. My mother was telling me that the ingredients they use here are the best in the market, that its gluten free, that the portions are healthy, blah blah blah, wah, wah, wah, give me more.... lol  Also gets a two thumbs up from my preschooler....
author: Barney E.

description:
Oh my, I think I'm obsessed with this place. Simple menu, but everything I've ordered has been completely delicious.

 There is something about their pizza crust which is just highly addictive. I believe it is a sourdough base, but with no discernible tang to it and then it has this incredible blistered salty crust. Just one salad offered, but again it is amazingly good with great texture and mix of ingredients such as grated hard boiled egg. Staff also are super nice, friendly and at times pretty darn funny. 

 I can often be seen waiting for them to open on a Wednesday after being closed for two days, shaking nervously and overly scratching at myself.
author: P R.

description: Best pizza in SF - hands down. I love love love love the people, the dough, the beer, the accessibility, the experience and the fact that it's down the bottom of my road. Cheers to you pizzahacker!!
author: rhiannon B.

description: This is my fave neopolitan pizza place in sf.  Crust is stupid amaze balls, great texture/crunch, salt crust is phenomenal. Ordered a margherita, rocket man and a yo vinny to go, it would've been better eaten there but it was still awesome 15 minutes later.  Can't go wrong with any of the choices, but the margherita really stands out.  So simple, yet tastes so complex...I was in love.  Had pizzeria delfina the next day and it just doesn't measure up to pizza hacker.  Cannot wait to come back!
author: Chon T.

description:
We got the Crowd Pleaser and Vinny to-go last night. I was really looking forward to the Crowd Pleaser since I'd seen so many reviews about it, but it was disappointing. The balsamic/purple cabbage made the whole thing WAY to bitter and overpowered any hint of sweet fig.

The Vinny was amazing. I love the hot pepper and mozzarella. The crust on both were delicious, and even better heated up the next day. They are also pretty expensive for small pies.
author: Alexandra W.

description: Probably my favorite pizza in SF.  I've tried the top shelf marg, short bridge, get a room, and rocket man.  All superb.  Love the sourdoughy crust.
author: Jim L.

description: They keep serving Burnt pizza! I love this place but it's so frustrating to continuously receive burnt pizzas. The owner is always super nice (4 times) however they kitchen should realize when the pizzas are burnt and not serve them.... please keep the quality high PizzaHacker
author: H B.

description: They now also have a kale caesar salad, which is pretty good. The pizza is still probably the best in the Bay area, excellent thin crust with great fresh toppings. All our friends (adults and kids) love it!
author: D. P.

description:
a good choice for thin crust pizza!

Had this booked marked and was craving NYC style pizza so I dragged the hubby out to the mission for some yummy pizza.

with a  simple chalkboard menu and communal seating, pizza hacker provides good food in a comfortable, casual setting. Lots of young families eating pizza that night.

We got the yo vinney and the house salad.

The house salad wasnt as good as I imagined based on the reviews, but had a good mix of fresh romaine, garbanzo, kidney, mozz, and some other toppings that eludes me. The dressing was light- almost too light- I felt like the salad needed some extra kick. Granted, getting over a cold my tastebuds were not 100% there.

The yo vinney pizza was delicious and just as I thought- thin but not too thin the middle would be mushy with a hint of seasalt in the crust. Little bits of sausage, cheese, tomato was sprinkeled on the top. @ $15 not bad for a SF pie. Granted this isnt your typical extreme pizza place so this is the price one pays for designer pies in this neck of the woods. The pizza is on the level of arinells pizza- true NY pizza but it wasnt greasy at all which I LOVE.

I was quite satisfied with this, but my hubby being the piggy he was said pre meal that he would go for a taco after the pizza =)

He did, but i left content and very happy with my pizza.

Would I return? Maybe, perhaps bring a out of towner friend for a casual dinner.

With so many of these new pop up pizza places, I must make my rounds.
author: Petri Y.

description:
Best Margherita pizza, freshest intense smooth sauce (not acidy), grilled crust.  

Rocketman excellent too!
author: Lisa T.

description:
Who doesn't want a place to call their own?

In 2014 a passionate pizza maker landed on La Lengua in a place all his own.

There's homemade sauce, creative toppings, and passion in every pie.

And every home needs a solid foundation.  The crust easily delivers here.  It's flavorful, crispy, slightly charred, and is a reminder of why good pizza is easy to come by.  

--Great pizzas like the pizza hacker's take time and dedication.

So thanks for all the years you schlepped your tricked out grill across the City to introduce us to what pizza really tastes like.

How lucky are we to depend on just the day of the week to get our fill of deliciousness at your permanent home?

Looking forward to calling this place home too.
author: Colleen C.

description:
We wanted something fun and casual, yet delicious, for our rehearsal dinner and immediately thought of our favorite pizza spot, Pizzahacker. From the beginning, Jeff was really responsive and excited to prepare a spot in the back of the restaurant to accommodate us.
We held our dinner at PizzaHacker over the weekend and Jeff and his team really went above and beyond for us. Great food and service in a lovely, perfect space. All of our guests came in from out of town and they all can't wait to visit PizzaHacker again on their next SF trip!
author: Courtney V.

description: Pizza is decent, but drink options for nonalcoholic drinks is limited. It's shared seating which I absolutely hate. We are lucky enough to sit at the bar. It's a very trendy San Francisco type pizza place. It's not relaxing.
author: David H.

description:
I have very conflicted feelings about PizzaHacker.
The food is amazing... but their customer service is not so amazing... borderline frustrating.

The place has a sort of "Cabo Cantina" look to it... I don't know if that is intentional. I only got that vibe because of the colorful string lightbulbs hanging across the restaurant. Besides the flashback to my cabo vacation, the place is waaayyy trendy. The employees look like they are all in some basement indie band. 

We ordered two pizzas, the Yo Vinny! and the Rocket Man. Both were so yummy! I especially liked the Yo Vinny! (marinated onions, mama lil's pickled goat horn peppers, house-made hot italian sausage, tomato sauce, fresh mozzarella). Probably one of the top five thin crust pizzas I've had for it being only $16. 

Although the pizzas were great... the customer service made me want to pick up an apron and do everything myself. We asked our waiter for water and patiently waited about 10 minutes while he did other things and passed by us about 15 times before finally asking another waiter. Then it took even LONGER for our waiter to come around to us to grab our order. And when it came time to pay our bill, we asked for our check and once again waited about 10 minutes before asking for our check again. Our waiter replied by saying "Yeah, yeah your check I got it..." and a few minutes later came by with the WRONG check. We were so fed up at this point that we just went up the counter to pay the right bill. My friend told our waiter that he gave us the wrong bill (the check he gave us was about $27 and we knew ours would be about $55). The waiter insisted that it was the right check before finally double checking and giving us the right bill. We were basically begging the kid to pay more money than he insisted. 

Overall, really yummy pizza... really bad customer service. I think it took more time to be seated, have our order taken, and our check given to us than to actually eat our pizza. It's not like we asked for crazy requests... just some water and our bill. Never knew it could take so much time and effort.
author: Erin K.

description:
Ate there last night and brought a guest who just moved from the east coast. We barely talked as we were both shoveling this glorious pizza in our mouth..but she kept saying (with a full mouth) "This pizza is SO FUCKING GOOD...SO FUCKING GOOD" And so fucking good it is.  I think some people who have said something about burnt crust are tripping or don't really appreciate a good Neapolitan style pizza. Crispy but chewy at the same time Sourdough thin crust and hand stretched Mozzarella? Yes please. I could drink their sauce. Really- the classic and "top-shelf" margaritas could not be any more perfect in their delicious simplicity. But they have interesting other options as well and all equally good. It's really no nonsense, casual atmosphere and I love that you can see them cooking the pizza from your seat while sharing a half carafe of wine at one of the big picnic style tables. They give you menus but who needs 'em when they've got the goods displayed on the huge chalkboard wall. Finally - normally I wouldn't even mention salad, but their 2 options are great and I love that you can get a family style bowl. We shared the Intermezzo salad, and it is actually worth mentioning. My guest absolutely loved it- loaded with so many fresh veggies, and large white beans and chickpeas topped off with a yummy dressing. I actually ate a ton of it when I would normally save all my appetite for the pizza. 
Anyway this place rules. I would choose this place over Beretta or Delfina any day of the week.
author: Rebecca L.

description: This pizza is TINY but so delicious! Had the Margarita and the Yo Vinny. Both were amazing. We could have used (at least) 3 pizzas for 3 of us. Curbside pickup was a total fail. Followed the instructions - waited for the text, pulled up, clicked the link, waited, waited, waited. No pizza. Eventually called and someone came out, but pretty sure no one was coming curbside otherwise. Worth the wait, this pizza is crazy good.
author: Tish M.

description: This place is straight up legit' the best pizza in town. I will fight anyone that says otherwise! That soft sourdough crust, that salt, the oil, and the incredibly thoughtful combinations of the freshest ingredients. It makes my knees weak! I'm not sure whats in the water down there but they should probably start making bagels too because this in New York City quality folks. Can't wait to go back. Also, the name rocks.
author: Penguin P.

description:
This place is great, I have no idea why anyone would give less than 4 stars. Very tasty pizza, I'm not a crust person but even I enjoyed the chewy crusts. I thought the pizzas needed a dash of salt, maybe this is why some thought they were tasteless, but it's easy to add salt and hard to take away, so I prefer it this way. Well dressed salad. 

On Friday we got there right before 8, within minutes there was probably a 45 minute wait.
author: Katherine W.

description:
Normally when you order pizza you get a stale loaf of bread with some tomato sauce and cheese on top. But, occasionally you find a place that delivers real authentic Italian pizza.

We ordered the Top Shelf Margherita and the Summer Fave - they were both excellent. The ingredients were super fresh, the dough baked to a perfect crisp and the flavors just worked. The Summer Fave seems to be a seasonal plate but it was definitely a standout.
author: Chris H.

description: They have the best pizza, that's for sure but the portions are small. There is a very good vibe inside, loud rock music playing and cool people hang around. I tried 3 different pizzas and they were all yummy yummy.
author: Kemal O.

description: I fall in love again each time I come here!  Seriously the best crust I have ever tasted. Complex flavors (house-made sausage and pickled peppers to name a few) complement the crispy sourdough crusts and make for a truly satisfying meal. I love the Margherita and the Yo Vinny. They only have one dessert but it is the perfect addition:  Mitchells chocolate ice cream topped with olive oil and sea salt. Thank you pizzahacker for making my pizza dreams come true!
author: A R.

description:
I love this place, it's simple and great. It feels a bit like a German beer garden with the benches and lights they use.

The crust is yummy, the sauce is great (I actually preferred the normal one over the "topshelf" one) 

I've had few of their pie's so far my fav pie's were the normal Margherita and the Rocketman- summer fave.

one of my fav places in the city.
author: Dor L.

description:
the only nice thing I can say is 'This is not the worst pizza I've had.'
burnt crust, dry, and loaded with foofy california topings. I rarely say this but; you're doing it wrong.
I should have been clued in by the friends who "love it" couldn't choke it down without drowning it in hot sauce. Taste buds must be destroyed.
author: Pete S.

description: This place is so yummy. I will definitely go back to try their other pizzas. Last night I had 'Get a Room' and it was excellent.
author: Gina G.

description: Do not use the Postmates App service to deliver your pizza. Twice we have had an issue with having our food delivered to us. After the second time using this service, Postmates has accepted our order, charged our credit card, and two hours later, our food never came. I could not contact Pizza Hackers and the delivery person was unreachable too. It seems criminal that this service and pizza place could allow such poor service.
author: John M.

description: Does the word "delicious" mean anything to you? If so, this is the place for you. The "Top Shelf" is off the charts and so is the ice cream. I would definitely recommend to family and friends. The bartender gave me great service and was knowledgable about the food. Repeat customer for sure.
author: Dan M.

description: We ate at Pizzahacker for the first time last Friday night and it was great.  We had an awesome server, Martha, who was delightful.  The salad and pizza are DELICIOUS.  We eat lots of pizza and will return to this restaurant.
author: Kelly R.

description: Came here on a Saturday at 5 pm just as they were opening up. Ordered the Farm girl Margarita for take out. Took me 15 minutes to get home and took my first bite. Wow. So much flavor. I can't imagine what it would have tasted like right our of the oven!!! Thin crust pizza and the crust was not bad, although I've had better in North Beach area. But this pizza place is definitely a place I'd come back to again. Solid.
author: Ny H.

description:
Went here last night for dinner with my husband and mom and we loved it! 

Started off with the intermezzo salad, fresh, crispy, and a huge portion!

My mom and I split the Rocket Man, which was a hit! My husband had the Yo Vinny which he also loved. Cool spot, was able to get a spot right when we walked in. Will be coming back again!
author: Kerry D.

description: Really good pizza! Fresh and tasty and pitchers of beer too! AlthoughI really like the pizza, I have left here hungry. The pizza isn't that filling. Seating isn't the most comfortable and kind of a strange ambiance. Friendly staff and good place to bring kids though. I live in the hood, so I keep comin! Bathrooms need some help. Dirty and missing towels.
author: Jo M.

description: If you aspire to new york pizza, the lack of any crispness on the crust will disappoint.  The screaming kids and slow service don't help.
author: A B.

description: Best pizza in the city. It's been long since I've gone to a restaurant and wanting to come back the next day. We ordered the margherita, rocket man with sausage, and crowd pleaser. All 3 pizzas were delish, so I don't think you can't go wrong. Also the space is fun, lively, and creative.
author: Happi Y.

description: Yum!  Delicious pizza and salad, great staff and kid friendly.  We found our new pizza spot!
author: Dana Y.

description: My kids won't stop talking about this place and the "rocket man" was delicious. Will definitely be going back.
author: Richard A.

description:
Me and my buddies ordered the 'Top Shelf Margherita' and 'Rocket Man.' Both had the makings of a tasty pie.  I was particularly excited about egg on pizza, yum!

But they came out burnt, to the point where two slices were inedible.  Only one slice of the 'Rocket Man' had egg on it, and to be honest I really struggle to remember anything tasty about either pizza.

The bottom line is the margherita had potential, and the Rocket Man ended up basically being flatbread with a more than healthy helping of arugula tossed on top.
author: Yaron G.

description: Pretty solid Za off the beaten Mission path.  We had the purple rain which has these delicious sweet tomatoes and prosciutto and some sweet cheese.  The crust was excellent and the flavor combinations really worked.  The salad they serve is enough for 3-4 people so next time I would probably nix the salad and eat more pizza.  I would definitely go back and try some of their other flavors.
author: Kirsten M.

description: What use to be a guy selling pizzas outside of clubs and bars made from his webber grill is now an actual restaurant spot in Bernal Heights! Pizza is seriously delicious because the quality of the ingredients used is spot on. Can't wait to eat here again!
author: Kristen C.

description: Great thin crust pizza! Delicious salad! Very fast getting food to the table despite being busy. Attentive service.
author: Larry B.

description:
So here we go...went there today for lunch after reading all the great reviews and being that I live right around the corner. The pizza was fair to midland. For the price, I would have enjoyed it more with some atmosphere. The décor is bland and boring. But what really got me was that the owner was there at the counter with his friends chatting and getting them drinks, food, etc.  Maybe I'm old fashioned, but when you are in your own restaurant, the proper thing to do is to go around to your customers (the paying folk), see how their experience is, thank them for coming, etc...not entertaining your friends/and or business associates. Entertain them at your home!!

Will not be going back or recommending to friends!!
author: Jake D.

description: We got a take out order a few weeks ago. The place is very kid friendly. There were several strollers in the restaurant and they have this huge chalkboard where kids can draw and play. The servers were unfazed by several toddlers playing with chalk dust and making a mess (a good thing in my opinion). Our order was ready ridiculously fast and when we got home the food was delicious. The pizza had a nice bubbly crust, the toppings were fresh and tasty. We also got the Intermezzo salad which is a nod to the former Intermezzo in Berkeley. It's a bit smaller portioned than the one Intermezzo used to serve but tastes just as good.
author: Joann C.

description:
I love pizza and I tend to order a margarita pizza as a point of comparison to other pizza places.

My pizza had some sections of burnt crust. Had the crust been cooked properly I think it would have been an ok pizza, but nothing to write home about.
author: Marie L.

description:
i got the get a room pizza and it was good. if i can eat the crust that means it's a good pizza. the dough was good, crust was great, it seems to need more flavor though. could be due to the sauce, felt like it needed more. but other than that it's good pizza.

again, dough is good, crust is great just needed more flavor for the toppings.

(this rating is strictly on the pizza, not the service)
author: Toni Rose M.

description: Came here tonight and my server was freakin fantastic. She was a really pretty, petite, Jewish-looking woman with short hair. She was so on the ball. Our food came out quickly and she gave us some great recommendations. Loved the margherita pizza and salad. mmmm. I am definitely coming back soon. WHOOO new restaurants.
author: Julia D.

description: I really liked this place. Easy going atmosphere. Great pizza and delicious house salad.  There is not a huge selection of foods but that just means that all the food they make is of quality.
author: Courtney C.

description:
Dazzling pies in a friendly relaxed atmosphere. Terrific! 
I have never liked arugula, but the PizzaHacker added arugula...it turns out I sometimes LOVE arugula!
author: John W.

description: Don't be too put off by the horribly douchey name. The food is fantastic and the prices are reasonable.
author: Jessica M.

description: I was so excited when I went to the place after read all the blogs and reviews about this place. We had a winter pie and a top shelf magarita at $15 each. The winter pie was not bad but didn't have the wow factor. As for the margarita, it's a little bland and the restaurant itself even gives out Asian chili pepper paste instead of the regular chili pepper flakes to add more flavor to it. I will go back to Vega for my pizza fix!
author: Yina M.

description: The crust is ridiculous , the closest one to A 16 , place is awesome , benches are perfect for group of friends to come hang out and have some beer, waitresses super gorgeous just sayin' .Pizzahacker the hottest pizza spot in town .
author: NAEL K.

description: Just great pizza. Really, it's just delicious. Thanks for opening in the neighborhood!
author: Bam B.

description:
From a pizza nut who has tried every worthy pizza joint in the Bay Area, this is THE BEST pizza PERIOD.  Rises above the heady artisan pizza competition in the Bay Area such as Una Pizza Napoletana, Tony's, Gialina, Pizzaiolo, Flour & Water...

The crust has the perfect crispness and char on the outside and chewiness on the inside.  Unlike pretty much every other Neopolitan style pie around, the crust is firm not soggy in the middle.  Has a subtle soughdough taste (elusive -- only Una PIzza has it) with nice sprinkle of smoked salt on the edge.  The house-pulled mozzarella cheese is creamy, flavorful, melted perfectly.  The housemade tomato sauce has just the right amount of sweetness and acidity.  The toppings are creative and complement each other very well.  We ordered six pies which all were great even though the restaurant was only three days old and running at full tilt.

The space has a nice, laid back feel but with an energetic buzz from the excited crowd noshing their pizzas.  A feel-good place you can go dressed however and just relax and have some great pie.
author: Pete's Za Z.

description: Best pizza I've had so far in San Francisco! The Margherita pizza was everything I hoped for and more. The smoked salt was a superb and tasty touch. The Crust was thin without being too crackery, and it was actually a bit soft to my liking. The sauce was just a little sweet and light... And it still tasted great the next day! Huge props to this place, I'll definitely be going back. The decor was cute, not overdone. Good vibes all around.
author: Alessandra S.

description:
The best pizza I've had in a long time. The crust is amazing, slightly charred and drizzled with olive oil (and salt?). The top shelf marg is beautiful in its simplicity, but the others sound tasty too.

It's noisy, but that might improve as they settle in. Also, if you go early, prepare for young'uns taking advantage of the chalkboard-walls. Thee tables are almost all communal, but with food this good (and fast!), everyone's in a friendly mood.

All pizzas are a flat $15, which includes tax, making things convenient.
author: Brian K.

description: Good pizza. A little too thin at the center of the pie, but VERY tasty. Great service. If you are two people dining, get two pizzas if you're hungry. Thanks for a pleasant experience Pizza Hacker.
author: Food L.

description:
I went here during the soft launch and it was outstanding.

I really dug the pizza with the egg on it w/ arugula and lemon and also liked the more traditional one that I had.

I've lived in New Haven and NYC and had great pizza and this is every bit as good as anything I've had out there. Really outstanding. 

They had about 5 to choose from. I do wish they had a few more options for pizza but I figure they'll expand their menu as they progress. Really glad that this opened and I hope they do delivery to Bernal soon.
author: Ben L.

description: Great Italian style wood oven pizza. Plus the salad is amazing.
author: JM G.

description: I'm so thrilled the Pizza Hacker opened his own place - and not too far from where we live.  We have enjoyed his pizzas all over town - he's my husband's favorite in SF.  The ambience is chill - good for neighborhood hipsters and young children/families alike.  Pizzas are delicious, as expected - and so is the salad (not as expected).  Only one white and one red wine available, but corkage is only $9.  Mitchell's Ice Cream is only a block away too, if you want dessert.
author: B. Y.

description: A must order is the marg. The ingredients are top notch. Love the music this place is dishing out. This was my first pizza hacker experience. We went on a Sunday and it was chill. No fuss. I could imagine things might be different on a Saturday night. Beers were delicious and the service were great. Some dude did fall off his seat while we were there. No backs, so caution. Enjoy the Za and laid back environment just don't don't go head over heels.
author: Kelly C.

description: Just had the Top Shelf Margherita last Friday.  I've been here only once before and had their standard Margherita and wanted to compare the two.  After my first or maybe second, I started tearing up and cried.  It was just that good.  Sure, I will probably never capture that moment again but I am indebted to the hacker for giving it to me.
author: avi a.

description: Good pizza and good price. Been here several times and it is consistent.  But last night was a pop up chili night.  I tried a frito chili pie and it was excellent.
author: John B.

description: Came across this place unexpected... However was very lucky I did! Great service and ambience. Felt like I was hanging out in a good friends backyard! I will be back for sure!! Great waitress!!
author: Elana F.

description: The service is amazing and the pizza is even better. I felt horrible rolling in 7 minutes before they closed, but everyone was super happy to make me a delicious pie.
author: Darren S.

description: My favorite pizza in the city! Their crust is addictive. I really like the Top Shelf Margherita and I love their salads, too. They have a bunch of cool tap beers if you're dining in. I like the patio lights and the vibe for eating with pals.
author: Erin A.

description:
top shelf margherita was sweeter than i expected.  was okay...

but the rocket man was really good!  dat dough
author: Jeffry C.

description: Get the yo vinny. Yum. And a pitcher of saison, yes please!
author: Bethany G.

description: Came here for something new on a Sunday night. The pizza was better than I thought. Nice crust, different flavors from a traditional pizza but the customer service was pretty crappy. The owner took our plates and asked how the food was. I told him it was pretty tasty, and gave me one of those "you don't know shit" kind of looks. Maybe I'm not hipster nor trendy enough,  but I know when people are singling me out because I don't look like everyone else...anywhoo, food is okay. Customer service is selective.
author: Dotty C.

description:
Hands down my favourite pizza place in the northern hemisphere.

Already was a fan of the popup at Vinyl every thursday, now I'm delighted to see its possible to get my pizza hookup also throughout the weekend. The sourdough crust of the pizza's are crunchy but not to the point it becomes dry. The topics are of amazing quality and perfectly balanced. You won't find your classic hawaii or salami pizza in here, I'd say the combination of toppings is more experimental with new innovative flavours. 

I usually go for the rocket man, but definitely can recommend the good old margarita. Also check out the secret soda menu!
author: Jorg V.

description: We love this place. Great for kids and adults. Many high chairs available and a chalk walk for doodling. Amazing pizza. One negative: last time we were there our server spilled pizza crumbs all over me when she was taking away an empty pie plate. Maybe it was payback for my screaming baby.
author: Leigh C.

description:
The top shelf margherita was truly fantastic. and the salad too, and they serve pizza wine!, cheap too. great surrounds, nice and basic, and  (at 5:30)  full of kids  learning to eat pizza right.  I love this place. I'd eat there all the time,  except i live in New York.

oh and try the calabrian chili paste. my new favorite restaurant condiment. except i'll never see it again until im back in town.

best pizza this year. easily.
author: Kevin K.

description: Great crispy crust, excellent ingredients, solid pie! Boiled down selection of great beer and wine. Kid friendly. Love the salads too. I'd take a photo but the pizza is gone already.
author: Bradd G.

description: Being new to the neighborhood, I came here on a friend's recommendation and was very very pleasantly surprised! I have lived in San Francisco for 4 years and this is some of the most delicious pizza I have had here! Fun environment and very yummy food!
author: Brigitte H.

description: Lovely place with the best pizza in the Bernal neighborhood #imo. The pizza crust is fresh, airy and with a light garlic, buttery taste; simply divine.#numNumNum.
author: David K.

description: Crazy but I loved the pizzas more when they were coming out of a makeshift grill. Regardless the pizza dough is perfect, the cheese is super tasty. I like the Vinny but pretty much every other pizza I've had too
author: Sigorney S.

description: This is my new favorite pizza in the city. I am officially addicted. I love the occasional hit of salt you get on the crust from time to time that makes you go "damn, this is soooo good!" I am not in agreement with the negative review about the noise and kids running around. Most restaurants are noisy in SF, esp pizza places. If you don't enjoy eating with kids, go late. Also, I would recommend avoiding take out if you can. It is ok at home but it is 10 times better fresh out of the oven. Enjoy!!
author: Alison H.

description: Had an awesome margherita pizza and the salad is soooooo tasty.  Can't wait to go back.
author: Pablo P.

description:
Best pizzas I've ever had anywhere ever.

And -  I nice restaurant, with good friendly service, blackboards for the kids and artists to draw on etc etc 

but the Pizza! Love it!
author: Linda C.

description: I consider myself a pizza snob.  With east coast roots and my favorite pizza emerging from a coal fired oven in the east village of New York, Pizza has come a long way in Northern California and Pizzahacker is the latest example of simple honest food created with fine ingredients and passion.  The pizzas are divine.  The crusts are perfect. The flavor and quantity of the toppings are balanced.  The beer and wine offerings were few but they were all excellent.  I am a fan of Mitchell's ice cream and would ave never thought of adding olive oil and sea salt to Mexican Chocolate.  NICE! I will be back for more very soon!
author: BUS B.

description: Great food great place.  Awesome new place in the mission.   Reasonable prices and a menu that I personally like.   Try it out, you'll like it. ..
author: May M.

description: Bad experience here last night. Starts with a disorganized system to wait for a table which leaves people awkwardly clustered by the door. Ordered two pizzas, a salad and a bottle of wine. Gal comes back and says they're out of Pinot Noir. Ordered the other red and she says "We're out of that too." How can you be out of all your red wine? It's a non-perishable. Anyway, since we were sitting right in front of the drafty door and could drink a nice glass of wine with our pizza cozier at home we asked her to box it to go. More disappointment when we get home and find that the arugula pizza, called the Rocket Man, had NO f**ckn arugula on it (or chile or lemon as posted). Just crust/cheese and a rubber egg (which admittedly could be due to the transport time). The "top-shelf" tomato sauce on the Margherita was meh and while a more naked salad could have had potential it was ruined by overdressing with poppyseed yukkiness. And it's their only dressing option. They do not have the act anywhere near together and the food isn't good enough to make up for that. I don't usually write reviews unless a place is really amazing one way or the other and this sure qualified.
author: Rachael A.

description: the food is pretty good! and love the casual vibe. I am a little worried the service has suffered though. I am a regular and called Sunday to see how long the wait would be before i shlepped my whole family down. The person who answered the phone was really rude...basically hung up on me. wow, i used to like the people here...hopefully it was a one-off thing.
author: Kim O.

description: Best pizza in town. Delicious flavors & great vibe inside! Their takeout is even amazing!
author: Nicole L.

description: Consistently fabulous pizza; one of the best crusts (and best deals) in town. Salads are always great, too! Friendly and prompt service.
author: Laura B.

description: I've only been once, but PizzaHacker is already one of my favorite pizza places in the city (it also helps that it's in my 'hood). We went there on a Wednesday night and got a seat immediately. We didn't know how big the pizza was, so my wife and I ordered two pizzas. We had one Yo Vinny (sausage, pickled hot peppers, onions, tomato sauce) and one Rocket Man (arugula, garlic, mozzarella, lemon, no sauce, egg on top), and both were delicious. I could've used a little bit more sausage on the Yo Vinny, but the peppers had a great kick, and the tomato sauce had a great tangy flavor to it. The Rocket Man had plenty of arugula on it -- I hate when pizza places only put a little bit of arugula on their pizzas -- and the arugula had a nice lemony kick from the dressing. We didn't finish the pizzas, but what really impressed me was how well the Yo Vinny pizza stood up the next day when I re-heated it for breakfast (I didn't think the arugula would keep well). That'll keep me going back, and that'll keep me ordering too much pizza every time so I can have more leftovers too. Great addition to the neighborhood.
author: Pilan C.

description: So happy to have an alternative to Delfina, Vega & Gialinia but sad to say it really doesn't compare.  Ordered the marguerita.  The crust was burnt, tasteless & chewy. Topping were bland.  The salad was  fresh & tasty.  Overall, for the price point, this place is going to require some TLC if its going to survive in the Mission.
author: Amy B.

description: I had an excellent pizza here!  It was pretty much perfect (the yo ginny!).  The taste was amazing, moz was sweet, everything just great!  Another plus, NO CRAZY LINES.  Wait staff was great too.  All in all wonderful.
author: N T.

description: Excellent pizza, and the ambience is fantastic!  As another reviewer notes, Christmas lights and a high ceiling make this feel like a back yard patio.  Would not hesitate to recommend for a date, casual evening among friends, or family outing.
author: Jeff D.

description: There's still only 4-5 beers to choose from, but the quality of those choices has improved. Yay to good beer.
author: Mary T.

description: Randomly went to this place to grab an easy dinner. Turned out to be one of the better pizzas I've had in a while. Fun quiet atmosphere which offers an open kitchen view for those at the bar or communal bench/picnic table seating for the rest of the room, both nice. Beer selection wasn't our favorite but the delicious Rocketman with Lamb meatballs more than made up for it.
author: Patrick L.

description: 3 stars because the crust is really good as well as the chili sauce on the tables you will need to add to your slice. This place gets an "A" in bland. The sauce was weak, if it wasn't for the lack of cheese so you could see the sauce you would think they forgot to put it on. I ordered the "Get a room" with sausage and olives. Thier was one nickel sized slice of sausage per slice but two olives and those are yummy, supposedly it had oregano which I couldn't see nor taste.  For an Italian slice go to Beretta or Zero zero. Where you get great crust and a flavorful satisfying slice. But hey if you like bland you will love it. P.s. the salad is meh.
author: Jannelly D.

description: This place is the bomb.  The crust is the best I have had.  The servers are super nice.  The Yo Vinnie pie is so good, I am losing sleep over it.
author: Sally C.

description: Love the pizzas!  So glad they are located in our neighborhood and adding to the great selection of current restaurants.  Would love if they had better wine selection!
author: Francine T.

description: Love this new Pizza place.  Great atmosphere and super tasty pizza.  Absolutely will come back.
author: Boris L.

description: We were fortunate enough to have the "Pizza Hacker" make pizzas at a party we hosted and it was fabulous. All of our guests raved about the pizzas and Jeff was so chill and lovely to work with. The pizzas were varied with fresh, inventive ingredients. We look forward to visiting his restaurant soon for some more deliciousness.
author: Kelly A.

description: Pizza Hacker is an excellent place to get your pizza fix, and has everything you need in a Pizza Place. It has nice owners, good service, atmosphere, and most importantly- great pizza.
author: Jack M.
